chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacie L. Beske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on April 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm. - WRONG CASE

Called cases 15CF72, 15CM342, 15CM493. Defendant Stacie L. Beske in court, in custody with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises right to have case 15CM342 heard in Br. 4. Ms. Beske wishes to proceed. Case 15CF72 all parties received revocation packet, no changes, corrections. Victim rights compliance.  Court reviews charges, penalties and rights in case 15CM342. Def pleads guilty to ct. 1, guilty to ct.2,  guilty to ct. 3, guilty to ct.4 in case 15CF342. Court reviews PQ&WOR, finds factual basis, finds pleas are made FVK&I, accepts pleas and finds def guilty of cts. 1, 2, 3, and 4 in case 15CM342. Cts. 5, 6, 7 are DRI (15CM342). Case 15CM493 ct. 1 is DRI. Dawn Beske makes statement. Atty Sempf heard. Atty Moeller heard. Def   makes stmnt. Court heard and imposes sent of:
15CF72
242 days DCJ - released no later than noon 4-12-16 if the shot is administered. 
181 days pre sent credit
enter judgment for any remaining costs

ct1 and ct.3

Ct. 2, 
30 days DCJ concurrent to case 15CF72 and ct. 4
Costs
Ct. 4
30 days DCJ concurrent to case 15CF72 and ct. 2
Case recalled 3:43pm. Atty Tienstra appears for State of WI. Atty Moeller appears in court for Stacie Beske. Def does not appear. Discussion held regarding credit.
Court heard, judgment to reflect in 15CM342 def has 115 days credit. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Probation Intake Order
Hearing on June 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Stacie L. Beske in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. An Amended Information was filed in Court.    Victim Rights Compliant. Parties have a joint recommendation.  Ct. reviewed CPR and PQWOR and heard plea of Guilty to the amended charge of OMVWOC-Joyriding.  Ct. found plea(s) given FKVI, accepted plea(s), and found Def. guilty of the charge(s).  Based upon her plea to Count 1, Count 2, Misd. Bail Jumping, is DRI.  Court accepted waiver of counsel.  Ct. found factual basis.  Ct. heard from State and Defense and sentenced as follows:
S/W, Probation for one year
AODA assessment within first 30 days of probation and followthru 
She must be actively involved in treatment by May 28, 2015 
If she fails to attend treatment, she's ordered, on 6-29-2015, to be committed to 60 days in the DCJail 
She's to return to Court on 6-26-15 at 8:15 am to report on whether or not she's involved in treatment; failure to appear starts that jail time. 
Counseling as recommended 
Court costs 
No restitution requested or ordered
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. Defendant is allowed access to her phone to obtain phone number.

(12:52) Defendant Stacie L. Beske in custody via video with attorney Greg E. Vollan (will appoint).  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State heard on bond - requests cash; Prelim requested within 20 day time limits. Prelim 3/5/15 at 8:30am in Br. 2; Court sets $200.00 CASH BOND with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. Def. may have access to her phone to obtain phone number.
